questiontext.text:
Systems of linear equations Systemer av lineære likninger

We first recall some basic results in linear (matrix) algebra. Consider a system of \(n\) equations in \(n\) unknowns \(x_1,x_2,\dots , x_n\): Vi begynner med å huske på noen grunnleggende resultater innen lineær algebra (matriseregning). Vurder et system med \(n\) likninger med \(n\) ukjente, \(x_1 , x_2, \dots, x_n\):

\(\qquad \begin{matrix}c_{11}x_1&+&c_{12}x_2&+&\dots &+&c_{1n}x_n&=&k_1\\ c_{21}x_1&+&c_{22}x_2&+&\dots &+&c_{2n}x_n&=&k_2\\ \vdots&+&\vdots&+&\dots &+&\vdots&=&\vdots\\ c_{n1}x_1&+&c_{n2}x_2&+&\dots &+&c_{nn}x_n&=&k_n\end{matrix}\)

We can write such a system in matrix form: Vi kan skrive et slikt system i matriseform:

\(\qquad \left[\begin{matrix}c_{11}&c_{12}&\dots &c_{1n}\\ c_{21}&c_{22}&\dots &c_{2n}\\ \vdots&\vdots&\ddots &\vdots\\ c_{n1}&c_{n2}&\dots &c_{nn}\end{matrix}\right] \left[\begin{matrix}x_1\\ x_2\\ \vdots\\ x_n\end{matrix}\right]= \left[\begin{matrix}k_1\\ k_2\\ \vdots\\ k_n\end{matrix}\right],\)

or equivalently, \(C\underline{x}=\underline{k}\). eller tilsvarende, \(C\underline{x}=\underline{k}\).

We see that \(C\) is an \(n\times n\) matrix (called the coefficient matrix), \(\underline{x}=[x_1, x_2,\dots ,x_n]^T\) is the \(n\times 1\) column vector of unknowns and \(\underline{k}=[k_1,k_2,\dots ,k_n]^T\) is an \(n\times 1\) column vector of given constants. Vi ser at \(C\) er en \(n\times n\) matrise (kalt koeffisientmatrisen), \(\underline{x}=[x_1, x_2,\dots ,x_n]^T\) er \(n\times 1\) kolonnevektoren av ukjente og \(\underline{k}=[k_1,k_2,\dots ,k_n]^T\) er en \(n\times 1\) kolonnevektor av konstanter.

The zero vector will be denoted by \({\underline 0}\). Nullvektoren vil bli betegnet av \({\underline 0}\).

If \(\underline{k}\ne {\underline 0}\) the system is called inhomogeneous. Hvis \(\underline{k}\ne {\underline 0}\) er systemet inhomogent.

If \(\underline{k}={\underline 0}\) the system is called homogeneous . Hvis \(\underline{k}={\underline 0}\) er systemet homogent .
